intro: Braya novae-angliae f. capitata, commonly known as the Cape Breton rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a compact cluster. The plant is native to the coastal regions of Nova Scotia, where it thrives in rocky, sandy, or gravelly habitats. Its morphology is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
